File Copy Service. org.dcm4chex.archive.dcm.hsm.FileCopyService The default constructor FileCopyService List of Copying rules, dependent upon which application - identified by the Calling AE title - sent the objects, and also dependent upon which called AE title was used in the Association Request. When the StoreScp service accepts several called AE titles (configured by the CalledAETitles attribute in the StoreScp service), different Store SCU applications (e.g. modalities) can be configured to use different called AE titles in their Association Requests to the same DICOM server of the archive. The comma separated list of file system paths after the (optional) condition defines the Copying destination. Each file systme path can be suffixed by !- to defer Copying to that destination outside a particular time interval.
Format:
[calling|called[!]=aeTitleFrom]dirPath!from-to | NONE
where
calling = create a copy condition for objects sent from this calling AE title
called = create a copy condition for objects are forwarded from the Called AE title in the Association request. Use != to mean NOT.
aeTitleFrom = the calling AE titles, or the called AE titles, separated by commas
dirPath = the destination file system identified by its path, in a comma-separated list (optional)
!from-to = start and end hour (0-23) when no Copying to this file system should be performed (optional)
NONE = do not use any Copying rules.
Example:
[calling=SCU1|SCU2,called!=SCP0]/mnt/nfs1,/mnt/nfs2!8-16
Forwards objects received from AE Title SCU1 or SCU2, when the Called AE Title in the Association Request is NOT SCP0, to file systems mounted at /mnt/nfs1 and /mnt/nfs2. Copying of objects received between 8am and 4pm to /mnt/nfs2 is delayed until 4 pm. CopyingRules java.lang.String Status of copied file. Enumerated values: DEFAULT, TO_ARCHIVE, ARCHIVED FileStatus java.lang.String Verify MD5 sum of copied file. VerifyCopy boolean Number and interval of retries made for failed Copy Requests.
Format:
Comma separated list of numberxinterval pairs.
The interval can be specified in seconds (##s), minutes (##m), hours (##h) or days (##d).
Example:
5x1m,10x10m means retry a total of 5 times, one minute apart for each retry; then retry a total of 10 times, 10 minutes apart for each retry. RetryIntervals java.lang.String Maximum number of concurrent invoked Copy Requests. Concurrency int Availability associated with new initiated file systems. Enumerated values: ONLINE, NEARLINE, OFFLINE, UNAVAILABLE. Availability java.lang.String Retrieve AE title associated with new initiated file systems. RetrieveAETitle java.lang.String User Info associated with new initiated file systems. UserInfo java.lang.String Used internally. Do NOT modify. StoreScpServiceName javax.management.ObjectName Used internally. Do NOT modify. QueueName java.lang.String Size of the buffer used to copy data. Keep the default value: 8192. BufferSize int Identifies JNDI (e.g: jnp://hostname:1099) with EJBs. Use LOCAL if EJBs are deployed in same JBoss instance. EJBProviderURL java.lang.String &defaultAttributes; &defaultOperations;
